definition: variant of 榜[bang3]
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees

to appear on the public roll of successful examinees (i.e. pass an exam)/to make the list/(of a song) to hit the charts
to flaunt/to advertise/to parade/boost/excessive praise
to fail the imperial exams/to flunk
lit. tablet with inscription in gold/pass list for the top imperial examinations/roll of honor

honor roll

Investiture of the Gods, major Ming dynasty vernacular novel of mythology and fantasy, very loosely based on King Wu of Zhou's 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] overthrow of the Shang, subsequent material for opera, film, TV series, computer games etc
ranking/ordered list/top 20/roll of honor/to come nth out of 100
the charts (of best-sellers)/table of ranking

sentences.english: He won two consecutive races and he was back into the championship.
sentences.chinese: 他连续赢得了两站又回到了冠军榜的竞争中。

sentences.english: I give pointers on how to do most of the quests in Outland.
sentences.chinese: 中国民歌榜如何提升伊金霍洛旗的影响力？

sentences.english: Beyonce leads the nominees with 10 nominations.
sentences.chinese: 歌后碧昂斯以10项提名领跑提名榜。

sentences.english: Winfrey, 54, jumped from the No. 6 spot on the entertainment trade paper's 2007 list to No. 1 this year.
sentences.chinese: 54岁的奥普拉从去年该榜的第六位跃至今年的首位。

sentences.english: According to the Hurun report, Zhang Yin is the world's wealthiest woman.
sentences.chinese: 据“胡润榜”报道，张茵是世界上最富有的女人。

sentences.english: Find out who has the magic touch among your friends by climbing the leaderboard.
sentences.chinese: 找出谁拥有你的朋友之间通过攀登领先榜的魔力。

sentences.english: This year’s Celebrity 100 was themed around celebrity entrepreneurs.
sentences.chinese: 今年福布斯全球100名人榜的主旋律是名人企业家。

sentences.english: HONG KONG — China leads in Olympic golds, but can it lead the global economy?
sentences.chinese: 中国在奥运金牌榜领先，但它是否能够带领全球经济？

sentences.english: By 2001, they had made their way onto the Forbes rich list.
sentences.chinese: 到2001年，他们已经跻身福布斯财富榜。

sentences.english: An idolized bang for the industry killer.
sentences.chinese: 为业界榜亦有一项杀手。

sentences.english: The music from the show is the second best selling album of the year.
sentences.chinese: 收录这首歌的专辑也排在畅销榜第二。

sentences.english: Objective Searching for the optimum formulation of"Diedabang Cataplasms".
sentences.chinese: 目的优选“跌打榜巴布剂”的最佳工艺。

sentences.english: Conclusion: The total alkaloids on herba aconiti have identified anti-inflammatory effect.
sentences.chinese: 结论榜嘎总碱对关节炎模型大鼠具有明显的抗炎作用。

sentences.english: Thanks to the prince to book at Tai Chi house list, with Wei Zhong will do chants.
sentences.chinese: 谢安石欲使王子敬书太极殿榜，以韦仲将事讽之。

sentences.english: The Financial Times has rated her as No. 1 in the top 50 women in world business.
sentences.chinese: 金融时报最近将她列为全球女商人榜50强的第一名。

sentences.english: He was a big star with music work; all of his songs were big hits.
sentences.chinese: 他是位巨星，他的所有歌曲都是打榜之作。

top of the list

to rank

to rank/ranking/seniority (among siblings)
to be located at
to appear on the public roll of successful examinees (i.e. pass an exam)/to make the list/(of a song) to hit the charts
to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
to rank (number 1, or third last etc)/to be among (those who are in a particular group)
to stand above/to occupy an important position/to rank (among the top few)
second place
year (e.g. school year, fiscal year)/annual
first place
